class.name: GoogleCart

doc.description: to the google checkout sandbox or production environment Refer demo/cartdemo.php for different use case scenarios for this code
doc.shortdescription: Creates a Google Checkout shopping cart and posts it

doc.parameter: the merchant id
the merchant key
doc.shortdescription: Has all the logic to build the cart's xml (or html) request to be

doc.parameter: a string representing a date in the iso 8601 date and time format: {
doc.shortdescription: Sets the cart's expiration date

doc.parameter: contains the data to be sent as merchant-private-data
doc.description: Google Checkout will return this data in the <merchant-calculation-callback> and the <new-order-notification> for the order. GC tag: {
doc.shortdescription: Sets the merchant's private data.

doc.parameter: the merchant's site edit cart url
doc.shortdescription: Sets the url where the customer can edit his cart.

doc.parameter: the merchant's site continue shopping url
doc.description: to the merchant's site after confirming an order. GC tag: {
doc.shortdescription: Sets the continue shopping url, which allows the customer to return

doc.parameter: true if the customer's phone number is *required* to complete an order. defaults to false.
doc.description: If set to true, the customer must enter a number, which Google Checkout will return in the new order notification for the order. GC tag: {
doc.shortdescription: Sets whether the customer must enter a phone number to complete an order.

doc.parameter: the merchant calculations callback url
true if the merchant has to do tax calculations. defaults to false.
true if the merchant accepts discount coupons. defaults to false.
true if the merchant accepts gift certificates. defaults to false.
doc.shortdescription: Sets the information about calculations that will be performed by the

doc.parameter: represents an item (defined in googleitem.php)
doc.shortdescription: Add an item to the cart.

doc.parameter: an object that represents a shipping method, must be one of the methods defined in googleshipping.php
doc.shortdescription: Add a shipping method to the cart.

doc.parameter: represents a default tax rule (defined in googletax.php)
doc.shortdescription: Add a default tax rule to the cart.

doc.parameter: represents an alternate tax table (defined in googletax.php)
doc.shortdescription: Add an alternate tax table to the cart.

doc.parameter: one of "UP", "DOWN", "CEILING", "HALF_DOWN" or "HALF_EVEN", described here: {
one of "PER_LINE", "TOTAL"
doc.shortdescription: Set the policy to be used to round monetary values.

doc.parameter: the google analytics id

Builds the cart's xml to be sent to Google Checkout.

doc.parameter: true for an enabled button, false for a disabled one
doc.shortdescription: Set the Google Checkout button's variant.

doc.return: with the returned http status code (200 if OK) in index 0 and the redirect url returned by the server in index 1
doc.description: Creates a GoogleRequest object (defined in googlerequest.php) and sends it to the Google Checkout server. more info: {
doc.shortdescription: Submit a server-to-server request.

doc.parameter: the merchant's site url where the form will be posted to
true for an enabled button, false for a disabled one. defaults to true. will be ignored if SetButtonVariant() was used before.
the locale of the button's text, the only valid value is 'en_US' (used as default)
whether to show Google Checkout text or not, defaults to true.
the background style of the button, one of 'white' or 'trans'. defaults to "trans"
doc.shortdescription: Get the Google Checkout button's html to be used in a server-to-server

doc.parameter: true for an enabled button, false for a disabled one. defaults to true. will be ignored if SetButtonVariant() was used before.
the locale of the button's text, the only valid value is 'en_US' (used as default)
whether to show Google Checkout text or not, defaults to true.
the background style of the button, one of 'white' or 'trans'. defaults to "trans"
doc.shortdescription: Get the Google Checkout button's html.

doc.parameter: true for an enabled button, false for a disabled one. defaults to true. will be ignored if SetButtonVariant() was used before.
the locale of the button's text, the only valid value is 'en_US' (used as default)
whether to show Google Checkout text or not, defaults to true.
the background style of the button, one of 'white' or 'trans'. defaults to "trans"
doc.shortdescription: Get the Google Checkout button's html to be used with the html api.

doc.parameter: the acceptance logo type, valid values: 1, 2, 3

class.variable: array( 'flat-rate-shipping' => array(), 'merchant-calculated-shipping' => array(), 'pickup' => array(), 'parameterized-url' => array(), 'url-parameter' => array(), 'item' => array(), 'us-state-area' => array('tax-area'), 'us-zip-area' => array('tax-area'), 'us-country-area' => array('tax-area'), 'postal-area' => array('tax-area'), 'alternate-tax-table' => array(), 'world-area' => array('tax-area'), 'default-tax-rule' => array(), 'alternate-tax-rule' => array(), 'gift-certificate-adjustment' => array(), 'coupon-adjustment' => array(), 'coupon-result' => array(), 'gift-certificate-result' => array(), 'method' => array(), 'anonymous-address' => array(), 'result' => array(), 'string' => array(), ) tags that can be used more than once, so they need to be numbered ("-#" suffix)used when using the html api
